messages.subject: Re: Chicken Pox Books
messages.msgSnippet: There s an Arthur chicken pox book (and a dvd too).  I ve seen the tv episode.  Although Arthur does go to school, in the chicken pox episode he is worried
messages.messageBody:
There's an Arthur chicken pox book (and a dvd too). I've seen the tv
episode. Although Arthur does go to school, in the chicken pox
episode he is worried about missing the circus with his family.
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-
/0316110507/qid=1106952339/sr=8-1/ref=pd_ka_1/103-4731924-0343035?
v=glance&s=books&n=507846

Sheila

--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "jenneferh2000"
<jenneferh2000@y...> wrote:
>
> Can anyone recommend any good children's books on chicken pox? One
> that doesn't end in, "and now I'm all better and can go back to
> school!" or one that doesn't have someone making fun of the child
> with chicken pox.
>
> Thanks for any leads!
>
> Jennefer in Oregon
> (who is waiting for her two small ones to break out in pox any day
> now...)

messages.subject: Chicken Pox Books
messages.msgSnippet: Can anyone recommend any good children s books on chicken pox?  One that doesn t end in, and now I m all better and can go back to school!  or one that
messages.messageBody:
Can anyone recommend any good children's books on chicken pox? One
that doesn't end in, "and now I'm all better and can go back to
school!" or one that doesn't have someone making fun of the child
with chicken pox.

Thanks for any leads!

Jennefer in Oregon
(who is waiting for her two small ones to break out in pox any day
now...)
